abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Technical and Vocational
            Training Project in the Bahamas. The project objective was
            to help implement major elements of the second phase of the
            Government's long term plan to expand and upgrade the
            country's training system. The project pursued two key
            objectives, namely: (i) to provide institutional development
            and improved policy implementation in training management
            and finance; and (ii) to expand and upgrade training
            capacity in combination with measures to use existing
            training capacity more effectively. The overall outcome of
            the project has been rated as moderately satisfactory. The
            project was successful in improving the management and
            sustainability of training, although more is still needed.
            Key lessons learned can be summarized as follows: a) Policy
            on sector development should be based on detailed sector
            work, a broader stakeholder participation and better
            commitment building; b) The Bank should initiate
            restructuring of projects when political priorities change,
            in order to retain ownership; c) Project objectives as
            defined with the governments in the SAR should be realistic,
            focused, and take into consideration the feasibility of
            achieving major policy and institutional changes over the
            short term; d) Supervision missions should be appropriately staffed.
